t.div:
PRINCIPALS
Fred Olsen Cruise Lines
Fred Olsen Crewing and Consultancy Services LTD (FOCCS)
Yinson Production AS
Carnival Cruise Lines
Fred Olsen Cruise Lines
Fred. Olsen Cruises is one of the businesses of the Fred. Olsen family. Based in the UK , Fred. Olsen business interests are varied.
They include travel and leisure interests (Fred. Olsen Travel Ltd), renewable energy (The Natural Power Consultants Ltd) and estate management (Forrest Estate Ltd). UK offices are located principally in London, Ipswich and south of Glasgow in Scotland.
Fred. Olsen Cruise Lines is located in Ipswich.Fred. Olsen Limited provides management, IT, office facilities and HR support services to these companies. To know more about the company, click www.fredolsencruises.co.uk
Fred Olsen Cruise Lines
Fred. Olsen Crewing and Consultancy Services Ltd. (FOCCS) provides innovative and tailored services for the transport, installation and maintenance of offshore wind parks. FOCCS can provide all the key elements required for offshore installation in provision of installation jack-ups, crew transfer vessels, skilled installation personnel and turn key solution.
Also, FOCCS offered the Operations and Maintenance phase which is the most critical in the lifetime of an offshore wind park as this phase is greatly affects overall life-cycle cost with an in-house capability to provide you with the necessary services, vessels, crew and service technicians.
Today, FOCCS is responsible for the daily operation of two (2) self elevating wind turbine installation and crane unit namely Bold Tern and Brave Tern.
Yinson Production AS
Yinson Production AS is committed to the highest standards with respect to Health, Safety and Environmental Protection and their objective is zero accidents throughout the operations.
Its vision is to become a preferred long-term partner for oil companies and/or oil field developers through a commitment to quality, adhering to long-term values and seeking continual improvement to the services it provides.
Maintaining close customer relationships, working cost-efficiently, ensuring, quality through continuous improvement will be, a long-sided safety, highest priority throughout Yinson Production’s operations.
Yinson Production will manage and control the above through it Management System that complies with the requirements of the international standard EN ISO 9001-2000, determining and setting quality objectives and means for measuring and analyzing the effectiveness of the process and procedures.
Carnival Cruise Lines
Carnival is “The World’s Most Popular Cruise Line”, with 25 ships operating 3 to 18 day voyages to The Bahamas, Caribbean, Mexican Riviera, Alaska, Hawaii, Canada, New England and Australia.

ABOUT US
Bahia Shipping Services, Inc. (BSSI) or simply Bahia was registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in December 1987 and started deploying Filipino seafarers in January 1988 for then principal, Blackfriars Shipping Co. Ltd. Bahia then provided seafarers for only five vessels, now the company has grown to be one of the leading providers of seafarers for foreign principals and continue to grow to provide employment to most Filipinos.
VISION STATEMENT
To provide our Principals with first-rate Filipino seafarers.
MISSION STATEMENT
Bahia Shipping Services Inc. is a company committed to recruit and supply STCW certified, competent, disciplined and hardworking Filipino seafarers for our foreign Principals.
We are committed to uphold the best interest of the Filipino seafarers and to continuously promote the Philippines as a significant source of seafarers in the global labor market.
QUALITY POLICY
To provide qualified and well-trained crew as required by our Principals in manning their vessels, and to meet the applicable statutory/regulatory requirements to ensure ship’s operation and protection of the marine environment.
OUR CORPORATE VALUES
We at Bahia Shipping Services Inc. were incorporated with a set of core values embodied by the Chairman of the Board and continues to be the standard of its employees.
INTEGRITY
We steadily adhere to strict moral and ethical codes in performing our duties and in interaction towards our customers.
LOYALTY
The company duly recognize the valuable contributions of the crewmembers. They are indeed the greatest assets of the company. We owe to this loyal seafarers the success of the company.
SERVICE
MEMBER; Filipino Association for Mariners’ Employment (FAME), the largest association of manning agencies in the Philippines since 1994.
OPERATIONAL EXCELLENCE
POEA Top Performer Awardee
We are POEA Top Performer Awardee for 2002 and 2006. Given to Bahia for its commendable performance and accomplishments. Two citations were likewise given in recognition to the agency’s promotion and creation of employment opportunities for Filipino seafarers.
ISO Certified 9001/2008 – Bureau Veritas Quality International (BVQI)
We are Bureau Veritas Quality International certified since 2000.
We are currently aiming for ISO 9001:2015 trasition in time for our re-Certification
Marlins Approved Test Center)
We are an accredited Marlins English Test Center since February 15, 2007.
In-House Processing of Contract
Since 2002, Bahia processed contracts in-house. Giiven as a privilege by POEA due to the volume of seafarers regularly deployed, and as an incentive due to the awards and citations received.
PDOS Accredited Center
Since 2003, Bahia is an accredited PDOS Training Center.
Maritime Labour Convention (MLC) 2006
“We have been certified with regard to MLC compliance since August 31, 2012 under Bureau Vertias”
Filipino Association for Mariners’ Employment Inc. (FAME)
Bahia was awarded last March 2015, a “Plaque of Recognition” in grateful appreciation of 20 years of loyal and dedicated membership and affiliation with the Association and for the active commitment, support and adherence to the vision and goals of the Association for the greater prosperity of its members in particular and the Philippine Seafaring and Maritime Industry in general.

div.h2: Welcome to Bahia Shipping Services Inc.
div.h3: We recruit and deploy Filipino seafarers for Cruise Vessels, Off-Shore vessels and Self Elevating Wind Turbine Installation and Crane Unit
Our foreign principals are Fred Olsen Cruise Lines, Yinson Production AS, Carnival Cruise Lines and Fred Olsen Crewing and Consultancy LTD

t.div:
FAQs
>> RECRUITMENT
>> CREWING
>> ALLOTMENT AND DEDUCTIONS
>> RECRUITMENT
What is a seafarer and how to be employed as such?
By definition, a seafarer is one who earns his/her living by service at sea. To be employed as such, the person should have the necessary skills and documents corresponding to the position available on board.
To know more about the Careers offered by our Principals, please click Careers Menu
What are the required documents to be a seafarer?
Generally speaking, those would be seafarers must possess the following documents
Certificate(s) of work employment
Valid Seaman’s Book or (SIRB)
Valid Passport
Valid Basic Training Certificate
Certificate(s) of work related training(s)
To know how to acquire such documents, please refer to the General Guidelines
I have the above documents, is it enough for me to get hired by your company?
No, additional requirements are based on the position applied, please see the Careers Menu for explanation on the different position requirements.
However, the minimum requirements for all positions in addition to the documents mentioned above, are the following:
Must be able to confidently communicate in English
Height requirement of at least 5’5″ for Males
Height requirement of at least 5’3″ for Females
Has at least 12 months of recent employment gained from an international or local vessel or extensive land-based experience gained from a reputable establishment.
How to apply in your Company?
You may send us your application by visiting our website at www.bahiashipping.ph and click Apply Now.
WE DO NOT ENTERTAIN WALK-IN APPLICANTS.
When and where can I follow-up my application?
Once your application passed the initial assessment, kindly expect a response from us for the status of your application.
WE DO NOT ENTERTAIN PERSONAL FOLLOW-UPS.
I am a referral by one of your seafarers, am I assured of an employment onboard by your company?
No, although referrals are given priority by the company, still referrals need to comply with the minimum requirements.
Do you charge placement fee?
ABSOLUTELY, NO PLACEMENT FEE IS TO BE COLLECTED.
>> RECRUITMENT
What is the contract duration of your seafarers?
The contract duration of our seafarers depend on what Principal they are employed, however the usual duration is up to 10 months.
What is your procedure regarding rejoining crew?
Crew rotation of seafarers belonging to principals, Fred Olsen Cruise Lines, Carnival Cruise Lines, Fred Olsen Crewing and Consultancy LTD, Yinson Production AS and Fred Olsen Marine Services are handled by their respective principals, vacation is usually minimum of two months.
I’m an ex-crew of your company and I wish to re-apply, can I do so?
Yes, you may contact your respective Crewing Managers.
I am a current crew of one of your Principals, and I want to apply to other Principals within the company, can I do so?
Yes, you may apply from one Principal to another. Submit your comprehensive resume and a copy of your last performance appraisal to Recruitment Coordinator. However, transfer is not guaranteed and employment is based on vacancy and Principal’s approval.
What are the positions deployed by your Company?
The positions supplied by Bahia differs from one principal to another, to know more, please click Careers Menu.

General Guidelines
Where and how do I get an NBI clearance?
The NBI clearance that you must have is for Visa – Seaman. You can apply at the NBI Clearance Center (Victory Central Mall #717 Old Victory Liner Cmpd. Rizal Ave., Monumento, Caloocan City or at any NBI Satellite Offices, NBI Regional / District Offices and NBI Kiosk nationwide.For a detailed procedure on how to obtain the certificate and the fees to be collected, please see NBI website.
Where do I get a copy of my birth certificate?
Birth Certificates are requested from The Office of the Civil Registrar General of the National Statistics Office. You may apply personally or for your convenience, NSO is accepting online applications, payments can also be made thru banks.For more details, you can login to their website at http://www.e-census.com.ph
How can I get an SSS ID?
Every seafarer must have a Social Security System (SSS) ID as required by the Philippine Government. For more information on where to apply, the requirements and the forms to be filled-up, please log on to their website at http://www.sss.gov.ph
What is CAV? And where can I get it?
For College graduates, you can secure your CAV or Certificate of Authentication and Verification from the CHED office NCR or to the CHED office in the provinces, depending on where your school is located, please see their website at http://www.ched.gov.ph/services/students/cav.html. For High School Graduates, you can secure your CAV from DECS NCR – (located at the back of SM City – Annex, Quezon City or from any DECS offices in the provinces depending on where your school is located
Where and how do I apply for a Passport?
Application for passport is now online.Applicants may set an appointment by going on line http://www.dfa.gov.ph/main/index.php/consular-services/passport or by calling 737-1000.Applicants are no longer required to bring photographs since they will have their picture taken using ePassport data capturing machines at DFA-OCA. OCA building is located at the corner of Macapagal Avenue and Bradco Street, Aseana Business Park.E-passport can be obtained through the different consular offices nationawide, click
http://www.dfa.gov.ph/main/index.php/about-the-dfa/rp-embassies-consulates-a-rcos/regional-consular-offices .
What is Basic Safety Course? Where can I take this course get the course?
Individuals who wish to pursue a career in seafaring should complete a Basic Safety Course (BSC) training obtained from an accredited maritime training center duly approved by the Maritime Training Council, a division of the Philippine Overseas Employment Agency.The course covers the mandatory minimum requirements prescribed in Regulation VI/1, and Section A-VI/1 of STCW’95. The training lasts for one week lecture and one day actual training. It covers the following subjects:
Elementary First Aid
Personal Survival Techniques
Fire Prevention and Fire Fighting
Personal Safety and Social Responsibility
Medical Emergency
First Aid
For a list of accredited training centers, log on to http://www.mtc.gov.ph
What are the requirements to secure a Seaman’s Book (Seafarer’s identification and Record Book) for new applicants?
Transcript of Record (High School TOR for High School Graduates) (College TOR for College Graduates)
School Diploma (High School Diploma for High School Graduates ) (College Diploma for College Graduates)
Certificate of Authentication and Verification (CAV)
Certified True Copy of Birth Certificate
NBI Clearance – visa seaman
2 pcs Passport size colored picture with white background
Basic Safety Course Certificate
Where do I apply for a Seaman’s Book?
File your application together with the above requirements at the Maritime Industry Authority (MARINA), located at Parkview Plaza, Kalaw cor Taft Ave, Manila.To know more about the requirements and procedures, you may login to their website at http://www.marina.gov.ph/faqs/default.aspx

div.a: Technical Education and Skills Development Authority (TESDA)
